metadata.title: fix stack overflow in Decode (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A buffer overflow flaw was found in Golang's library encoding/pem. This flaw allows an attacker to use a large PEM input (more than 5 MB), causing a stack overflow in Decode, which leads to a loss of availability. 
            STATEMENT: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, 8 and 9 are affected, because the code-base is affected by this vulnerability.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact, and the issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, hence, marked as Out-of-Support-Scope.

Red Hat Developer Tools - Compilers (go-toolset-1.16-golang & go-toolset-1.17-golang), ships the vulnerable code and affected by this vulnerability.

For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/ and Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle & Updates Policy: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

criterions.comment: servicemesh-proxy is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
servicemesh-proxy-wasm is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
servicemesh-grafana is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 is installed
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
